elements.content: A 3-D open-framework nickel aluminophosphate [NiAlP2O8][C2N2H9] has been solvothermally synthesized using ethylene glycol as the solvent and ethylenediamine as the template. Its structure is assembled through 1-D AlP2O8 3- chains with corner-sharing 4-MRs via transition metal Ni2+ ions. The 1-D AlP2O8 3- chains are connected through octahedral Ni atoms, which are coordinated to the terminal oxygens of 1-D AlP2O8 3- chains and the amino groups of the template. Infinite Ni−O−Ni chains are formed along the [001] direction.
elements.clean_text: A 3-D open-framework nickel aluminophosphate [NiAlP2O8][C2N2H9] has been solvothermally synthesized using ethylene glycol as the solvent and ethylenediamine as the template. Its structure is assembled through 1-D AlP2O8 3- chains with corner-sharing 4-MRs via transition metal Ni2+ ions. The 1-D AlP2O8 3- chains are connected through octahedral Ni atoms, which are coordinated to the terminal oxygens of 1-D AlP2O8 3- chains and the amino groups of the template. Infinite Ni-O-Ni chains are formed along the [001] direction.

elements.content: The search for new microporous compounds through rational design has received great attention in recent years, especially in the aspects of microporous aluminophosphates and related materials. These materials show rich compositional and structural diversity compared with the aluminosilicate zeolites.
elements.clean_text: The search for new microporous compounds through rational design has received great attention in recent years, especially in the aspects of microporous aluminophosphates and related materials. These materials show rich compositional and structural diversity compared with the aluminosilicate zeolites.

elements.content: So far, the main approach to reach the rational synthesis of these target materials is through rational selection of the template agents according to theoretical prediction. Another possible strategy to construct new frameworks is through condensation of a lower dimensional network under suitable conditions. Recently, our lab and others have successfully synthesized a variety of organically templated aluminophosphates with one-dimensional (1-D) chains, two-dimensional (2-D) layers, and three-dimensional (3-D) interrupted open-framework structures built up from Al units (AlO4, AlO5, or AlO6) and PO4 units by sharing bridging oxygen atoms. Their structures exclusively contain terminal P−OH and/or PO groups. This leads to a nonunity stoichiometry of Al and P in the framework, such as AlP2O8 3-, Al2P3O12 3-, Al3P4O16 3-, Al4P5O20 3-,16,17and Al5P6O24 3-. The existence of terminal P−OH and PO groups indicates that higher dimensional framework can possibly be assembled from a lower dimensional network through condensation. Due to the restriction of Loweinstein's rule, i.e., there is no P−O−P connection allowed, the terminal phosphate groups must be condensed across an extra Al or other metal species.
elements.clean_text: So far, the main approach to reach the rational synthesis of these target materials is through rational selection of the template agents according to theoretical prediction. Another possible strategy to construct new frameworks is through condensation of a lower dimensional network under suitable conditions. Recently, our lab and others have successfully synthesized a variety of organically templated aluminophosphates with one-dimensional (1-D) chains, two-dimensional (2-D) layers, and three-dimensional (3-D) interrupted open-framework structures built up from Al units (AlO4, AlO5, or AlO6) and PO4 units by sharing bridging oxygen atoms. Their structures exclusively contain terminal P-OH and/or PO groups. This leads to a nonunity stoichiometry of Al and P in the framework, such as AlP2O8 3-, Al2P3O12 3-, Al3P4O16 3-, Al4P5O20 3-,16,17and Al5P6O24 3-. The existence of terminal P-OH and PO groups indicates that higher dimensional framework can possibly be assembled from a lower dimensional network through condensation. Due to the restriction of Loweinstein's rule, i.e., there is no P-O-P connection allowed, the terminal phosphate groups must be condensed across an extra Al or other metal species.

elements.content: Transition metal atoms can be incorporated into the frameworks to form many metal substituted aluminophosphates (MeAPOs); they have a strong coordination ability to the oxygen atoms. In this work, we have successfully assembled the 1-D AlP2O8 3- chains into a 3-D open-framework nickel aluminophosphate through the incorporation of transition metal Ni2+ ion.
elements.clean_text: Transition metal atoms can be incorporated into the frameworks to form many metal substituted aluminophosphates (MeAPOs); they have a strong coordination ability to the oxygen atoms. In this work, we have successfully assembled the 1-D AlP2O8 3- chains into a 3-D open-framework nickel aluminophosphate through the incorporation of transition metal Ni2+ ion.

elements.content: The 1-D AlP2O8 3- chain compound (1) is synthesized using ethylenediamine (en) as a template in an ethylene glycol solvothermal system. The anionic chain, as seen in Figure , is made up of linear corner-sharing Al2P2 four-membered rings (4-MRs) parallel to the [010] direction. The layers are stabilized by interlamellar +H3NCH2CH2NH3 + and NH4 + cations as reported before. All AlO4 tetrahedra each shares four oxygens with adjacent P atoms, whereas all PO4 tetrahedra each shares only two oxygens with adjacent Al atoms, leaving the other two oxygens terminal. These teriminal P−OH and PO groups will have the potential to further condense through an extra metal cation to build up a higher dimensional framework.
elements.clean_text: The 1-D AlP2O8 3- chain compound (1) is synthesized using ethylenediamine (en) as a template in an ethylene glycol solvothermal system. The anionic chain, as seen in Figure , is made up of linear corner-sharing Al2P2 four-membered rings (4-MRs) parallel to the [010] direction. The layers are stabilized by interlamellar +H3NCH2CH2NH3 + and NH4 + cations as reported before. All AlO4 tetrahedra each shares four oxygens with adjacent P atoms, whereas all PO4 tetrahedra each shares only two oxygens with adjacent Al atoms, leaving the other two oxygens terminal. These teriminal P-OH and PO groups will have the potential to further condense through an extra metal cation to build up a higher dimensional framework.

elements.content: 1-D [AlP2O8]3- anionic chains parallel to the [001] direction.
elements.clean_text: 1  1-D [AlP2O8]3- anionic chains parallel to the [001] direction.

elements.content: With the incorporation of Ni2+ into the framework, a 3-D open-framework nickel aluminophosphate, designated NiAPO-1, is formed in the same reaction system, i.e., using ethylenediamine as a template and ethylene glycol as the solvent.
elements.clean_text: With the incorporation of Ni2+ into the framework, a 3-D open-framework nickel aluminophosphate, designated NiAPO-1, is formed in the same reaction system,  i.e., using ethylenediamine as a template and ethylene glycol as the solvent.

elements.content: A suitable single crystal with dimensions of 0.06 × 0.05 × 0.03 mm was selected for single-crystal X-ray diffraction analysis. The X-ray powder diffraction pattern of the product is very consistent with the simulated one, proving that the as-synthesized compound is a single phase.
elements.clean_text: A suitable single crystal with dimensions of 0.06 × 0.05 × 0.03 mm was selected for single-crystal X-ray diffraction analysis. The X-ray powder diffraction pattern of the product is very consistent with the simulated one, proving that the as-synthesized compound is a single phase.

elements.content: Single-crystal X-ray diffraction analysis gives that NiAPO-1 crystallizes in the monoclinic space group P21/c, with lattice parameters a = 8.542 (2) Å, b = 15.564 (3) Å, c = 7.627(2) Å, and β = 110.60(1)°. NiAPO-1 has the empirical formula [NiAlP2O8][C2N2H9].
elements.clean_text: Single-crystal X-ray diffraction analysis gives that NiAPO-1 crystallizes in the monoclinic space group P21/c, with lattice parameters a = 8.542 (2) Å, b = 15.564 (3) Å, c = 7.627(2) Å, and β = 110.60(1)°. NiAPO-1 has the empirical formula [NiAlP2O8][C2N2H9].

elements.content: In contrast to previous Ni-substituted microporous aluminophosphates, a stoichiometric mixing of Ni and Al in the framework has been found in NiAPO-1. Figure shows the framework structure viewed along the [001] direction, which contains 8-MRs with the template agents protruding into the 8-MR openings. The 1-D AlP2O8 3- chains parallel to the [100] direction are assembled through octahedral Ni atoms, which coordinated to the terminal oxygens of the 1-D AlP2O8 3- chains and the amino groups of the template.
elements.clean_text: In contrast to previous Ni-substituted microporous aluminophosphates, a stoichiometric mixing of Ni and Al in the framework has been found in NiAPO-1. Figure  shows the framework structure viewed along the [001] direction, which contains 8-MRs with the template agents protruding into the 8-MR openings. The 1-D AlP2O8 3- chains parallel to the [100] direction are assembled through octahedral Ni atoms, which coordinated to the terminal oxygens of the 1-D AlP2O8 3- chains and the amino groups of the template.

elements.content: Framework structure of NiAPO-1 viewed along the [001] direction.
elements.clean_text: 2  Framework structure of NiAPO-1 viewed along the [001] direction.

elements.content: The 1-D AlP2O8 3- anionic chains and the −Ni−O−Ni− chains are cross-linked with each other. Figure is the −Ni−O−Ni− chain running along the [001] direction, showing the connectivity of the octahedral Ni atoms with the phosphates and the ethylenediamine template. The Ni atoms connect with each other via an O(2) bridging atom to form an infinite zigzag chain. Each Ni atom coordinates with one N atom of the ethylenediamine template with a Ni−N bond length of 2.077 Å. Each Ni atom shares five oxygens with adjacent P atoms, two of which bridge one P(1) atom. The Ni−O bond distances are in the range of 1.999−2.224 Å. It is noted that the O(2) atom is a μ3-O, which bridges two Ni atoms and one P(1) atom. Two Ni atoms and one P(2) are connected through oxygen atoms to form a 3-MR, which is rarely observed in 3-D open-framework structures. Magnetic measurement of NiAPO-1 suggests that NiAPO-1 is paramagnetic with a magnetic moment of 2.2 μB, consistent with a Ni2+ d 8 spin state. The unique −Ni−O−Ni− chains might lead to some interesting magnetic properties, which will be further studied.
elements.clean_text: The 1-D AlP2O8 3- anionic chains and the -Ni-O-Ni- chains are cross-linked with each other. Figure  is the -Ni-O-Ni- chain running along the [001] direction, showing the connectivity of the octahedral Ni atoms with the phosphates and the ethylenediamine template. The Ni atoms connect with each other via an  O(2) bridging atom to form an infinite zigzag chain. Each Ni atom coordinates with one N atom of the ethylenediamine template with a Ni-N bond length of 2.077 Å. Each Ni atom shares five oxygens with adjacent P atoms, two of which bridge one P(1) atom. The Ni-O bond distances are in the range of 1.999-2.224 Å. It is noted that the O(2) atom is a μ3-O, which bridges two Ni atoms and one P(1) atom. Two Ni atoms and one P(2) are connected through oxygen atoms to form a 3-MR, which is rarely observed in 3-D open-framework structures. Magnetic measurement of NiAPO-1 suggests that NiAPO-1 is paramagnetic with a magnetic moment of 2.2 μB, consistent with a Ni2+ d 8 spin state. The unique -Ni-O-Ni- chains might lead to some interesting magnetic properties, which will be further studied.

elements.content: −Ni−O−Ni− chain running along the [001] direction, showing the connectivity of Ni octahedra with the phosphates and amino groups of the template molecules.
elements.clean_text: 3  -Ni-O-Ni- chain running along the [001] direction, showing the connectivity of Ni octahedra with the phosphates and amino groups of the template molecules.

elements.content: The template molecule not only acts as a ligand for Ni atom, but also plays a charge balance role in its monoprotonated state for the negatively charged [NiAlP2O8]- macroanion. Thermogravimetric analysis shows that the template molecules decompose in the region 270−450 °C with a weight loss of 17% (theoretical value:  18%). X-ray powder diffraction analysis shows that NiAPO-1 transforms to an amorphous phase above 450 °C. ICP analysis gave the content of Ni, Al, and P is 17.1%, 7.6%, and 17.6% (Calcd. Ni, 17.4%; Al, 8.0%; P, 18.4%), respectively. Elemental analysis gave the content of C, H, and N as 6.5%, 2.5%, and 7.2%. (Calcd. C, 7.1%; H, 2.7%; N, 8.3%), respectively. The composition of [NiAlP2O8][C2N2H9] generated from chemical analysis is in agreement with the empirical formula given by single-crystal X-ray diffraction analysis.
elements.clean_text: The template molecule not only acts as a ligand for Ni atom, but also plays a charge balance role in its monoprotonated state for the negatively charged [NiAlP2O8]- macroanion. Thermogravimetric analysis shows that the template molecules decompose in the region 270-450 °C with a weight loss of 17% (theoretical value: 18%). X-ray powder diffraction analysis shows that NiAPO-1 transforms to an amorphous phase above 450 °C. ICP analysis gave the content of Ni, Al, and P is 17.1%, 7.6%, and 17.6% (Calcd. Ni, 17.4%; Al, 8.0%; P, 18.4%), respectively. Elemental analysis gave the content of C, H, and N as 6.5%, 2.5%, and 7.2%. (Calcd. C, 7.1%; H, 2.7%; N, 8.3%), respectively. The composition of [NiAlP2O8][C2N2H9] generated from chemical analysis is in agreement with the empirical formula given by single-crystal X-ray diffraction analysis.

elements.content: In conclusion, using Ni2+ transition metal ion, a 1-D aluminophosphate chain can be successfully assembled by connecting the terminal oxygens with Ni octahedra. It is possible that the 1-D AlP2O8 3- chain species are first formed during the crystallization followed by its assembly around the Ni2+ cations and the template molecules. Further investigation of the formation mechanism is underway. The successful synthesis of NiAPO-1 demonstrates that many types of new 3-D open-frameworks can be assembled by lower dimensional networks that contain terminal oxygen groups via transition metal cations. This work will further assist in the rational design and synthesis of target materials.
elements.clean_text: In conclusion, using Ni2+ transition metal ion, a 1-D aluminophosphate chain can be successfully assembled by connecting the terminal oxygens with Ni octahedra. It is possible that the 1-D AlP2O8 3- chain species are first formed during the crystallization followed by its assembly around the Ni2+ cations and the template molecules. Further investigation of the formation mechanism is underway. The successful synthesis of NiAPO-1 demonstrates that many types of new 3-D open-frameworks can be assembled by lower dimensional networks that contain terminal oxygen groups via transition metal cations. This work will further assist in the rational design and synthesis of target materials.

elements.content: Tables of crystal data, structure solution and refinement, atomic coordinates, bond lengths and angles, and anisotropic thermal parameters for NiAPO-1. This material is available free of charge via the Internet at http://pubs.acs.org.

Supporting Information Available 

Tables of crystal data, structure solution and refinement, atomic coordinates, bond lengths and angles, and anisotropic thermal parameters for NiAPO-1. This material is available free of charge via the Internet at http://pubs.acs.org.

cln_elements.content:
Single-crystal X-ray diffraction analysis gives that NiAPO-1 crystallizes in the monoclinic space group P21/c, with lattice parameters a = 8.542 (2) Å, b = 15.564 (3) Å, c = 7.627(2) Å, and β = 110.60(1)°. NiAPO-1 has the empirical formula [NiAlP2O8][C2N2H9].

The template molecule not only acts as a ligand for Ni atom, but also plays a charge balance role in its monoprotonated state for the negatively charged [NiAlP2O8]- macroanion. Thermogravimetric analysis shows that the template molecules decompose in the region 270−450 °C with a weight loss of 17% (theoretical value:  18%). X-ray powder diffraction analysis shows that NiAPO-1 transforms to an amorphous phase above 450 °C. ICP analysis gave the content of Ni, Al, and P is 17.1%, 7.6%, and 17.6% (Calcd. Ni, 17.4%; Al, 8.0%; P, 18.4%), respectively. Elemental analysis gave the content of C, H, and N as 6.5%, 2.5%, and 7.2%. (Calcd. C, 7.1%; H, 2.7%; N, 8.3%), respectively. The composition of [NiAlP2O8][C2N2H9] generated from chemical analysis is in agreement with the empirical formula given by single-crystal X-ray diffraction analysis.
cln_elements.clean_text:
Single-crystal X-ray diffraction analysis gives that NiAPO-1 crystallizes in the monoclinic space group P21/c, with lattice parameters a = 8.542 (2) Å, b = 15.564 (3) Å, c = 7.627(2) Å, and β = 110.60(1)°. NiAPO-1 has the empirical formula [NiAlP2O8][C2N2H9]. 

The template molecule not only acts as a ligand for Ni atom, but also plays a charge balance role in its monoprotonated state for the negatively charged [NiAlP2O8]- macroanion. Thermogravimetric analysis shows that the template molecules decompose in the region 270-450 °C with a weight loss of 17% (theoretical value: 18%). X-ray powder diffraction analysis shows that NiAPO-1 transforms to an amorphous phase above 450 °C. ICP analysis gave the content of Ni, Al, and P is 17.1%, 7.6%, and 17.6% (Calcd. Ni, 17.4%; Al, 8.0%; P, 18.4%), respectively. Elemental analysis gave the content of C, H, and N as 6.5%, 2.5%, and 7.2%. (Calcd. C, 7.1%; H, 2.7%; N, 8.3%), respectively. The composition of [NiAlP2O8][C2N2H9] generated from chemical analysis is in agreement with the empirical formula given by single-crystal X-ray diffraction analysis.
